text: Thank you for visiting our website.
name: Katie Yang

actionables.message: Which side of me do you want to explore?

Intro.slogan: I am a Software Developer first and UI/UX Designer second
Intro.message1: My passion: improve people's quality of life by standing at the intersection of technology and human-centered design.
Intro.message2: During my free-time, I am into watching anime, learn about interactive art, and watch/perform stand-up comedy.

HeaderContent.title: ZOOX Autonomous Vehicle In Car Display
HeaderContent.detail: The display is Macbook Pro 14-inch in size and is located on the side of the seat. Created mood boards and 24 high-fidelity pages. Wireframed and prototyped with animations and transitions. Created lock screen design to prevent accidental interactions because of the physical placement of the display. Designed a full set of safety instructions and protocols, including declaring emergencies and video chat with staff.

first.cause: Passengers' safety is paramount, and ZOOX as a start-up company must take strict precautions for their reputation
first.solution: Measures to ensure the safety of passengers and how to deal with them after an incident is required.

second.cause: ZOOX is a provider of novel technologies and products
second.solution: Showcase the technology involved and how the vehicle works

third.cause: ZOOX is currently positioned as a driverless taxi service provider
third.solution: It needs to have the usual features of taxi services, such as changing destinations

fourth.cause: As a fully autonomous vehicle, ZOOX do not have the control panel and steering wheel of ordinary cars
fourth.solution: Require ways to adjust interior environment settings, such as internal temperature

fifth.cause: Passengers' attention does not need to be on the road
fifth.solution: Entertainment can be provided to enhance the experience, such as in-car music player

sixth.cause: The screen is located at the side of passenger's seat, so it may be touched by mistake
sixth.solution: Requires mechanism to prevent accidental changes

content.detail2: Declare emergencies, video call with safety advisor

content.detail1: Showcase what is detected by Computer Vision
content.detail2: Showcase how the road is like from the vehicle's perspective
Authenticate passenger, change destination, and cancel trip

first.cause: The seat wraps around and is beside the passenger's shoulder, so there might be accidental touches
first.solution: After a period of idleness, a lock screen would appear with basic information like time left till destination and car speed

second.solution: Explain the safety functionalities, how to open the doors, and ways ZOOX ensure ride safety

third.cause: Passengers need to know the current location and might be curious to see what the road is like from the ZOOX vehicle's view
third.solution: Need to switch between Map View and Car View

fourth.cause: Music play and in-door environment controls might not be used frequently
fourth.solution: A pull-out page for these functions

fifth.solution: Lacks time for typing during emergencies, so needs pre-set templates  and options for most likely scenarios

sixth.solution: Might be no video even after connecting or the passenger isn't able to speak, so pre-set templates should be set too

Moodboard.title: Moodboard
Moodboard.detail: Choose Moddboard 2 becuase it is closer too ZOOX official case and more distinguishable with other ride share companies
Moodboard.description1: Moodboard 1. Light mode design that gives out a smart soft technology feeling as well as elegance with the bright and clean visual design. Mostly uses pastel colors to work as contrast to the background to aid information display.
Moodboard.description2: Moodboard 2. Dark mode design that gives out a serious futuristic, technological ambiance. High saturation colors are used as contrast to the background to put emphasis on the displayed information.

description.text1: Changed screensaver unlocking mechanism from swiping from right to left to from bottom to top, which is more in line with the motion of unlocking mobile phones or tablets. Removing the arrow also saves left and right spaces.
description.text2: Simplified the information displayed on the screensaver, making it cleaner
description.text3: Changed the orientation of the expandable page from horizontal to vertical, making the pull-out animation more concise and intuitive
description.text4: Instead of swiping the page sideways to switch between the map and the car's view, one can press the toggle button. Other than requiring a smaller range of motion, it allows the passenger to have a better idea about what the other option is.

HeaderContent.title: What Color: an Arduino based color detection toy
HeaderContent.detail: This product encourages 4+ year olds to learn about colors with surrounding objects. After the color is detected by the sensor, its red, yellow and blue composition will be displayed on WhatColor's touchscreen, and the child can then draw with this color. Showing the RGB composition not only can teach children what red, yellow, and blue are, but also color mixing and more advanced color concepts such as coral and cyan for those that already know RGB.

Intro.title: Introduction
Intro.message: According to CDC, children at the age of 4 should reach the cognitive milestone of being able to name a few colors of items
Intro.detail1: What Color is for 4+ children that are studying the basic colors (red, yellow, blue), or has already learned the basics and learn about color mixing
Intro.detail2: Encourage children to scan object colors and draw with it when exploring
Intro.detail3: Heighten children's sensitivity in different shades and learn about color mixing
Intro.detail4: Composition: color sensors + touch screen + Arduino + 3d printed case

need.title: Need analysis:
need.message: 4 year olds should be able to name a few colors of items.

task.title: Task analysis:
task.message1: Found toy with similar concept: magnetic drawing board. Performed task analysis with an online
task.message3: with children interacting and reviewing a board.

discovery.title: Main takeaways:
discovery.message1: 3 year-old child could lift a 710g item
discovery.message2: pen with a diameter of 1.2cm could be easily utilized by 1 year- old in a grabbing hand position

summary.detail1: Took in consideration of ergonomics to make it portable
summary.detail2: Handle is placed on the left to not be in the way during drawing, so they could hold the toy and pen to run around at the same time
summary.detail3: Added touch screen and pen for drawing entertainment
summary.detail4: Similar to tablets and magnetic drawing board that children are familiar with

thoughts.detail1: Then thought about how putting the color sensor on the back of the product fits more closely with people's habit of scnaning objects with our phones or tablets.
thoughts.detail2: This change is reflected in 3D modeling.

modeling.title: 3D Modeling
modeling.message1: The 9V battery is placed at the bottom of the product, so the balance point of this device would be more towards the bottom. This make it easier for children to hold and run around with it while avoiding affordance of smashing
modeling.message2: According to Kong, the optimal handle diameter for grip force tasks is 19.7% of the user's hand length. Therefore, the best diameter for a 4 year-old with hand length of 10 cm would be 1.97 cm
modeling.message3: Made sure shell thickness at any point is at least 1.2 cm

summary.detail1: The product's name is written at the top of the toy to indicate which orientation this device should be held
summary.detail2: The device weighs about 300g, which wouldn't cause musculoskeletal injury among young children

detail3.title: Conducted usability testing with a 4 year old female and a 8 year old female. To protect their privacy, videos wouldn't be shared.
detail3.detail1: All of the participants took the pen out by poking at its top, rather than using the space at the right-side of the pen.
detail3.detail2: The handle is placed on the left so it wouldn't hinge most child's writing (because right-handedness is the most common), but younger child seems to like grabbing it with their right hand, which could reverse the orientation.

summary.detail1: This prototype is influenced by the constraint of available hardware, so there are lots of room for improvements based on user feedback
summary.detail2: Future iterations will only consider industrial level hardwares
summary.detail3: Possible routes: tablet to hold with two hands, single-hand scanning device, extend upon smart watches for children...
summary.detail4: Basic on the paper Improving Colour Patterns to Assist People with Colour Vision Deficiency, it could help color-blind children to understand colors and colors of every day objects

HeaderContent.title: JARney Scheduler Page Redesign
HeaderContent.detail: 此产品鼓励4岁+的孩子通过寻找物品来学习颜色。在识别一个物品的颜色后，What Color的触摸屏上会显示此颜色的红黄蓝构成，然后孩子可以用这个颜色进行绘画。显示红黄蓝的构成不仅可以教孩子什么是红色、黄色、蓝色，而且对于已经熟知红黄蓝的孩子，可以教他们颜色混合和更进阶的颜色概念，如珊瑚色、青色。
